turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Ah, well, we haven't had to run around like you. When're you due?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: End a April.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Any others?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: This'll be our first. We've been waiting a long time.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: That's wonderful. Mm-mm. It'll change your life, a course.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah, I know that!

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: They can really take over, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You have children?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: I thought you'd never ask. The older one is Janet, she's nine, and the younger one is Morgan.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, now he's adorable.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: He's three now. Course, not in that picture.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, he's adorable.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Yah, he -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Where'd you get him that parka?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Both of these.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, no, I can't let you do that.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Oh, don't be silly.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, okay - thank you, Detective.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SIBERT
turns.text: Oh, don't be silly.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Mr. Mohra?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Officer Olson.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yah, right-o.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...So, I'm tendin' bar there at Ecklund & Swedlin's last Tuesday and this little guy's drinkin' and he says, 'So where can a guy find some action - I'm goin' crazy down there at the lake.'  And I says, 'What kinda action?' and he says, 'Woman action, what do I look like,' And I says 'Well, what do I look like, I don't arrange that kinda thing,' and he says, 'I'm goin' crazy out there at the lake' and I says, 'Well, this ain't that kinda place.'

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: So he says, 'So I get it, so you think I'm some kinda jerk for askin',' only he doesn't use the word jerk.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: I unnerstand.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: And then he calls me a jerk and says the last guy who thought he was a jerk was dead now. So I don't say nothin' and he says, 'What do ya think about that?'  So I says, 'Well, that don't sound like too good a deal for him then.'

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Ya got that right.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: And he says, 'Yah, that guy's dead and I don't mean a old age.' And then he says, 'Geez, I'm goin' crazy out there at the lake.'

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: White Bear Lake?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well, Ecklund & Swedlin's, that's closer ta Moose Lake, so I made that assumption.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Oh sure.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: So, ya know, he's drinkin', so I don't think a whole great deal of it, but Mrs. Mohra heard about the homicides out here and she thought I should call it in, so I called it in. End a story.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: What'd this guy look like anyways?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh, he was a little guy, kinda funny- lookin'.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Uh-huh - in what way?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Just a general way.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Okay, well, thanks a bunch, Mr. Mohra. You're right, it's probably nothin', but thanks for callin' her in.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh sure. They say she's gonna turn cold tomorrow.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Yah, got a front movin' in.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Ya got that right.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Hiya, Norm. How ya doin', Margie? How's the fricassee?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Pretty darn good, ya want some?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: No, I gotta - hey, Norm, I thought you were goin' fishin' up at Mile Lacs?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: The numbers y'asked for, calls made from the lobby pay phone at the Blue Ox. Two to Minneapolis that night.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: First one's a trucking company, second one's a private residence.  A Shep Proudfoot.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh... A what?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Shep Proudfoot. That's a name.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Yah, okay, I think I'll drive down there, then.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Oh, yah? Twin Cities?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Where you girls from?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: Chaska.

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: Well, the little guy, he was kinda funny-looking.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: In what way?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: I dunno. Just funny-looking.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Can you be any more specific?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: I couldn't really say. He wasn't circumcised.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Was he funny-looking apart from that?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: So you were having sex with the little fella, then?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Is there anything else you can tell me about him?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: No. Like I say, he was funny-looking. More'n most people even.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: And what about the other fella?

turns.speaker: HOOKER ONE
turns.text: They said they were goin' to the Twin Cities?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah?

turns.speaker: HOOKER TWO
turns.text: LeSeure. But I went to high school in White Bear Lake.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okay, I want you to tell me what these fellas looked like.

turns.speaker: HOOKER TWO
turns.text: He was a little older. Looked like the Marlboro man.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: HOOKER TWO
turns.text: Yah. Maybe I'm sayin' that cause he smoked Marlboros.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HOOKER TWO
turns.text: A subconscious-type thing.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, that can happen.

turns.speaker: HOOKER TWO
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I'm talkin' about your potential.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You're not a C student.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Uhn.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: And yet you're gettin' C grades. It's this disparity there that concerns your dad and me.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You know what a disparity is?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Okay. Well, that's why we don't want ya goin' out fer hockey.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Oh, man!

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: ...What's the big deal? It's an hour -

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Good to see ya again, Jerry. If these numbers are right, this looks pretty sweet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, those numbers are all right, bleemee.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: The financials are pretty thorough, so the only thing we don't know is your fee.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...My fee? Wade, what the heck're you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Jerry - we thought you were bringin' us an investment.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, right -

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: You're sayin' - what're you sayin'?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, see, I don't need a finder's fee, I need - finder's fee's, what, ten percent, heck that's not gonna do it for me. I need the principal.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Jerry, we're not just going to give you seven hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: We're not horse-trading here, Wade, we just gotta bite the bullet on this thing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What's the next step here, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They're gonna call, give me instructions for a drop. I'm supposed to have the money ready tomorrow.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Okay. We'll get the money together. Don't worry about it, Jerry. Now, d'you want anyone at home, with you, until they call?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, I - they don't want - they're just s'posed to be dealin' with me, they were real clear.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Ya know, they said no one listenin' in, they'll be watchin', ya know. Maybe it's all bull, but like you said, Stan, they're callin' the shots.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Okay. And Scotty, is he gonna be all right?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, geez, Scotty. I'll go talk to him.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Wade's got a point there. I'll handle the call if you want, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, no. See - they, no, see, they only deal with me. Ya feel this, this nervousness on the phone there, they're very - these guys're dangerous -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So you're goin' to the Gophers on Sunday?

turns.speaker: SALESMAN
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You wouldn't have an extra ticket there?

turns.speaker: SALESMAN
turns.text: They're playin' the Buckeyes!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: SALESMAN
turns.text: Ya kiddin'!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Yah, okay...

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Look, Dad, there is no fucking way -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...How ya doin' there, Scotty?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Dad! What're they doing? Wuddya think they're doin' with Mom?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's okay, Scotty. They're not gonna want to hurt her any.  These men, they just want money, see.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: What if - what if sumpn goes wrong?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, no, nothin's goin' wrong here. Grandad and I, we're - we're makin' sure this gets handled right.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Dad, I really think we should call the cops.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No! We can't let anyone know about this thing! We gotta play ball with these guys - you ask Stan Grossman, he'll tell ya the same thing!

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Yeah, but -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We're gonna get Mom back for ya, but we gotta play ball. Ya know, that's the deal. Now if Lorraine calls, or Sylvia, you just say that Mom is in Florida with Pearl and Marty...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Mr. Lundegaard?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Huh? Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I wonder if I could take just a minute of your time here -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What... What is it all about?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Huh? Do you mind if I sit down - I'm carrying quite a load here.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...You're the owner here, Mr. Lundegaard?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Naw, I... Executive Sales Manager.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, you can help me. My name's Marge Gunderson -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: My father-in-law, he's the owner.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh. Well, I'm a police officer from up Brainerd investigating some malfeasance and I was just wondering if you've had any new vehicles stolen off the lot in the past couple of weeks - specifically a tan Cutlass Ciera?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Mr. Lundegaard?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Brainerd?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah. Yah. Home a Paul Bunyan and Babe the Blue Ox.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Babe the Blue Ox?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, ya know we've got the big statue there. So you haven't had any vehicles go missing, then?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No. No, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okey-dokey, thanks a bunch. I'll let you get back to your paperwork, then.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, no, I'm kinda - I'm kinda busy -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I unnerstand. I'll keep it real short, then. I'm on my way out of town, but I was just - Do you mind if I sit down? I'm carrying a bit of a load here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, I -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, it's this vehicle I asked you about yesterday. I was just wondering -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, like I told ya, we haven't had any vehicles go missing.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okay, are you sure, cause, I mean, how do you know?  Because, see, the crime I'm investigating, the perpetrators were driving a car with dealer plates. And they called someone who works here, so it'd be quite a coincidence if they weren't, ya know, connected.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, I see.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: So how do you - have you done any kind of inventory recently?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The car's not from our lot, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: but do you know that for sure without -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, I would know. I'm the Executive Sales Manager.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, but -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We run a pretty tight ship here.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I know, but - well, how do you establish that, sir? Are the cars, uh, counted daily or what kind of -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Ma'am, I answered your question.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ... I'm sorry, sir?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Ma'am, I answered your question.  I answered the darn - I'm cooperating here, and I...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Sir, you have no call to get snippy with me. I'm just doin' my job here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not, uh, I'm not arguin' here. I'm cooperating... There's no, uh - we're doin' all we can...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, I'll do a damned lot count!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Sir? Right now?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sure right now! You're darned tootin'!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...If it's so damned important to ya!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, I -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hon? Got the growshries.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Thank you, hon. How's Fargo?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, real good.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Dad's here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, real good. How you doin'?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Pretty good, Mr. Lundegaard.  You're damned hard to get on the phone.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, it's pretty darned busy here, but that's the way we like it.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: That's for sure. Now, I just need, on these last, these financing documents you sent us, I can't read the serial numbers of the vehicles on here, so I -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But I already got the, it's okay, the loans are in place, I already got the, the what, the -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yeah, the three hundred and twenty thousand dollars, you got the money last month.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, so we're all set.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yeah, but the vehicles you were borrowing on, I just can't read the serial numbers on your application. Maybe if you could just read them to me -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But the deal's already done, I already got the money -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yeah, but we have an audit here, I just have to know that these vehicles you're financing with this money, that they really exist.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, well, they exist all right.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I'm sure they do - ha ha! But I can't read their serial numbers here. So if you could read me -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, but see, I don't have 'em in front a me - why don't I just fax you over a copy -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No, fax is no good, that's what I have and I can't read the darn thing -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, okay, I'll have my girl send you over a copy, then.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Okay, because if I can't correlate this note with the specific vehicles, then I gotta call back that money -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, how much money was that?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Three hundred and twenty thousand dollars. See, I gotta correlate that money with the cars it's being lent on.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, no problem, I'll just fax that over to ya, then.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No, no, fax is -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I mean send it over. I'll shoot it right over to ya.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, real good, then.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Jerry Lundegaard.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: All right, Jerry, you got this phone to yourself?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well... yah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Know who this is?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, yah, I got an idea. How's that Ciera workin' out for ya?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Circumstances have changed, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, what do ya mean?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Things have changed. Circumstances, Jerry. Beyond the, uh... acts of God, force majeure..

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What the - how's Jean?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Jerome Lundegaard?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: This is Reilly Deifenbach at GMAC. Sir, I have not yet received those vehicle IDs you promised me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah!  I... those are in the mail.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Mr. Lundegaard, that very well may be. I must inform you, however, that absent the receipt of those numbers by tomorrow afternoon, I will have to refer this matter to our legal department.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: My patience is at an end.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Good day, sir.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Yah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: ...Dad?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's okay, Scotty.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Where're you going?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Be back in a minute. If Stan calls you, just tell him I went to Embers. Oh, geez -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, Shep Proudfoot said -

turns.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
turns.text: Shep said you'd be here at 7:30. What gives, man?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Shep said 8:30.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
turns.text: We been sitting here an hour.  I've peed three times already.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm sure sorry. I - Shep told me 8:30. It was a mix-up, I guess.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
turns.text: Ya got the car?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, you bet. It's in the lot there. Brand-new burnt umber Ciera.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
turns.text: Yeah, okay. Well, siddown then.  I'm Carl Showalter and this is my associate Gaear Grimsrud.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, how ya doin'. So, uh, we all set on this thing, then?

turns.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
turns.text: Sure, Jerry, we're all set. Why wouldn't we be?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, no, I'm sure you are. Shep vouched for you and all. I got every confidence in you fellas.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S VOICE
turns.text: ...Dad?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S VOICE
turns.text: Stan Grossman called.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, okay.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S VOICE
turns.text: Twice.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S VOICE
turns.text: ...Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S VOICE
turns.text: Are you calling Stan?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well... I'm goin' ta bed now.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yah, pretty good.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Whatcha watchin' there?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Norstars.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Who they playin'?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: OOOoooh!  His reaction synchronizes with a reaction from the crowd.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wade, have ya had a chance to think about, uh, that deal I was talkin' about, those forty acres there on Wayzata?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You told me about it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, you said you'd have a think about it. I understand it's a lot of money -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: A heck of a lot. What'd you say you were gonna put there?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: lot. It's a limited -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I know it's a lot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I mean a parking lot.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yah, well, seven hundred and fifty thousand dollars is a lot - ha ha ha!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, well, it's a chunk, but -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I thought you were gonna show it to Stan Grossman. He passes on this stuff before it gets kicked up to me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, you know Stan'll say no dice. That's why you pay him.  I'm asking you here, Wade. This could work out real good for me and Jean and Scotty -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Jean and Scotty never have to worry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How ya doin', Wade?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What's goin' on there?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, nothing, Wade. How ya doin' there?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Stan Grossman looked at your proposal. Says it's pretty sweet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No kiddin'?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: We might be innarested.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No kiddin'! I'd need the cash pretty quick there. In order to close the deal.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Come by at 2:30 and we'll talk about it. If your numbers are right, Stan says its pretty sweet. Stan Grossman.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, thanks, Stan, it's a pretty -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What kind of finder's fee were you looking for?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ...Huh?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Stan and I're okay.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: We're good to loan in.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: But we never talked about your fee for bringin' it to us.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, but, Wade, see, I was bringin' you this deal for you to loan me the money to put in. It's my deal here, see?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You're sayin' that we put in all the money and you collect when it pays off?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, no. I - I'd, I'd - pay you back the principal, and interest heck, I'd go - one over prime -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What the heck were you thinkin'? Heck, if I'm only gettin' bank interest, I'd look for complete security. Heck, FDIC. I don't see nothin' like that here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but I - okay, I would, I'd guarantee ya your money back.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm not talkin' about your damn word, Jerry. Geez, what the heck're you?... Well, look, I don't want to cut you out of the loop, but his here's a good deal.  I assume, if you're not innarested, you won't mind if we move on it independently.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: - All's I know is, ya got a problem, ya call a professional!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No! They said no cops! They were darned clear on that, Wade! They said you call the cops and we -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well, a course they're gonna say that! But where's my protection? They got Jean here! I give these sons a bitches a million dollars, where's my guarantee they're gonna let her go.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, they -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: A million dollars is a lot a damn money! And there they are, they got my daughter!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, but think this thing through here, Wade. Ya give 'em what they want, why wont' they let her go? You gotta listen to me on this one, Wade.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Heck, you don't know! You're just whistlin' Dixie here! I'm sayin', the cops, they can advise us on this! I'm sayin' call a professional!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No! No cops! That's final! This is my deal here, Wade! Jean is my wife here!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're darned tootin'!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Ah, dammit!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: ... Stan, I'm thinkin' we should offer 'em half a million.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now come on here, no way, Wade!  No way!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Dammit! I wanna be a part a this thing!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, Wade! They were real clear! They said they'd call tomorrow, with instructions, and it's gonna be delivered by me alone!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: It's my money, I'll deliver it - what do they care?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: All the more reason!  I don't want you - with all due respect, Jerry - I don't want you mucking this up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The heck d'ya mean?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: They want my money, they can deal with me. Otherwise I'm goin' to a professional.  He points at a briefcase.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: ...There's a million dollars here!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, see -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Look, Jerry, you're not sellin' me a damn car. It's my show here.  That's that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Say, Shep, how ya doin' there?

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Say, ya know those two fellas ya put me in touch with, up there in Fargo?

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Put you in touch with Grimsrud.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, yah, but he had a buddy there. He, uh -

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Well, I don't vouch for him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, that's okay, I just -

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: I vouch for Grimsrud. Who's his buddy?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Carl somethin'?

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Never heard of him. Don't vouch for him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, that's okay, he's a buddy of the guy ya vouched for, so I'm not worryin'. I just, I was wonderin', see, I gotta get in touch with 'em for, I might not need it anymore, sumpn's happenin', see -

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Call 'em up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yah, well, see, I did that, and I haven't been able to get 'em, so I thought you maybe'd know an alternate number or what have ya.

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Hiya, Lou.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Margie. Thought you might need a little warm-up.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, thanks a bunch. So what's the deal, now? Gary says triple homicide?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah, looks pretty bad. Two of'm're over here.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Where is everybody?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Well - it's cold, Margie.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okay, so we got a state trooper pulls someone over, we got a shooting, and these folks drive by, and we got a high-speed pursuit, ends here, and this execution-type deal.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'd be very surprised if our suspect was from Brainerd.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Ya see something down there, Chief?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh - I just, I think I'm gonna barf.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Geez, you okay, Margie?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'm fine - it's just morning sickness.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Well, that passed.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah. Now I'm hungry again.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You had breakfast yet, Margie?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah. Norm made some eggs.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah? Well, what now, d'ya think?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Let's go take a look at that trooper.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: There's two of 'em, Lou!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, this guy's smaller than his buddy.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Oh, yah?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: How's it look, Marge?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, he's got his gun on his hip there, and he looks like a nice enough guy. It's a real shame.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You haven't monkeyed with his car there, have ya?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Somebody shut his lights. I guess the little guy sat in there, waitin' for his buddy t'come back.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah, woulda been cold out here.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Heck, yah. Ya think, is Dave open yet?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You don't think he's mixed up in -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, no, I just wanna get Norm some night crawlers.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You look in his citation book?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah...

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: ...Last vehicle he wrote in was a tan Ciera at 2:18 a.m.  Under the plate number he put DLR - I figure they stopped him or shot him before he could finish fillin' out the tag number.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: So I got the state lookin' for a Ciera with a tag startin' DLR.  They don't got no match yet.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'm not sure I agree with you a hunnert percent on your policework, there, Lou.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, I think that vehicle there probly had dealer plates. DLR?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: ...Geez.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah. Say, Lou, ya hear the one about the guy who couldn't afford personalized plates, so he went and changed his name to J2L 4685?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah, that's a good one.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: How we doin' on that vehicle?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: No motels registered any tan Ciera last night. But the night before, two men checked into the Blue Ox registering a Ciera and leavin' the tag space blank.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Geez, that's a good lead. The Blue Ox, that's that trucker's joint out there on I-35?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yah. Owner was on the desk then, said these two guys had company.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...You can sleep, hon. It's early yet.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Gotta go?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'll fix ya some eggs.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: That's okay, hon. I gotta run.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Gotta eat a breakfast, Marge.  I'll fix ya some eggs.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Aw, you can sleep, hon.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Ya gotta eat a breakfast...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...I'll fix ya some eggs.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Aw, Norm.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, yah, course I remember.  How are ya? What time is it?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, geez. It's quarter to eleven.  I hope I dint wake you.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, that's okay.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, I'm down in the Twin Cities and I was just watching on TV about these shootings up in Brainerd, and I saw you on the news there.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I thought, geez, is that Margie Olmstead? I can't believe it!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, that's me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, how the heck are ya?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okay, ya know. Okay.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah - how are you doon?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, pretty good.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Heck, it's been such a long time, Mike. It's great to hear from ya.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah... Yah, yah. Geeze, Margie!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Geez! You look great!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah - easy there - you do too!  I'm expecting, ya know.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I see that! That's great!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...What can I get ya?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Just a Diet Coke.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...This is a nice place.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, ya know it's the Radisson, so it's pretty good.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You're livin' in Edina, then?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, yah, couple years now. It's actually Eden Prarie - that school district. So Chief Gunderson, then! So ya went and married Norm Son-of- a-Gunderson!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah, a long time ago.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Great. What brings ya down - are ya down here on that homicide - if you're allowed, ya know, to discuss that?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, yah, but there's not a heckuva lot to discuss. What about you, Mike? Are you married - you have kids?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, yah, I was married. I was married to - You mind if I sit over here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...I was married to Linda Cooksey -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, I - Mike - wyncha sit over there, I'd prefer that.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Huh? Oh, okay, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, just so I can see ya, ya know. Don't have to turn my neck.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, sure, I unnerstand, I didn't mean to -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, no, that's fine.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, sorry, so I was married to Linda Cooksey - ya remember Linda?  She was a year behind us.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I think I remember Linda, yah.  She was - yah. So things didn't work out, huh?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: And then I, and then I been workin' for Honeywell for a few years now.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, they're a good outfit.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, if you're an engineer, yah, you could do a lot worse. Of course, it's not, uh, it's nothin' like your achievement.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It sounds like you're doin' really super.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, well, I, uh... it's not that it didn't work out - Linda passed away. She, uh...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yah, I, uh... She had leukemia, you know...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, I didn't...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It was a tough, uh... it was a long - She fought real hard, Marge...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, ya know, that's, uh - what can I say?...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Better times.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I was so... I been so... and then I saw you on TV, and I remembered, ya know... I always liked you...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, I always liked you, Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I always liked ya so much...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It's okay, Mike - Should we get together another time, ya think?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No - I'm sorry! It's just - I been so lonely - then I saw you, and...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...I'm sorry... I shouldn't a done this... I thought we'd have a really terrific time, and now I've...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It's okay...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You were such a super lady...  and then I... I been so lonely...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It's okay, Mike...

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, you do reside their at 1425 Fremont Terrace?

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Anyone else residing there?

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, Mr. Proudfoot, this call came in past three in the morning.  It's just hard for me to believe you can't remember anyone calling.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Now, I know you've had some problems, struggling with the narcotics, some other entanglements, currently on parole -

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, associating with criminals, if you're the one they talked to, that right there would be a violation of your parole and would end with you back in Stillwater.

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Now, I saw some rough stuff on your priors, but nothing in the nature of a homicide...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...I know you don't want to be an accessory to something like that.

turns.speaker: SHEP
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: So you think you might remember who those folks were who called ya?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah, is this Marge?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Margie Olmstead?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Well, yah. Who's this?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: This is Mike Yanagita. Ya know - Mike Yanagita. Remember me?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...Mike Yanagita!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: ...Hello?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Norm?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, I'm leavin' this mornin', back up to Brainerd.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Well, I'm sorry I won't see ya.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Mm. But ya think he's all right? saw him last night and he's -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Well, it was nothin' specific he said, it just seemd like it all hit him really hard, his wife dyin' -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: His wife?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Linda.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Linda Cooksey?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No. No. No. They weren't - he, uh, he was bothering Linda for about, oh, for a good year.  Really pestering her, wouldn't leave her alone.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: So... they didn't...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No. No. They never married.  Mike's had psychiatric problems.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh. Oh, my.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah, he - he's been struggling. He's living with his parents now.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh. Geez.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah, Linda's fine. You should call her.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Geez. Well - geez. That's a suprise.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: His wife. This guy says she was kidnapped last Wednesday.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: The day of our homicides.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: And this guy is...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Lundegaard's father-in-law's accountant.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Gustafson's accountant.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: But we still haven't found Gustafson.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: - looking.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Sorry - didn't copy.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Still missing. We're looking.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Copy. And Lundegaard too.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah. Where are ya, Margie?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, I'm almost back - I'm driving around Moose Lake.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Oh. Gary's loudmouth.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, the loudmouth. So the whole state has it, Lundegaard and Gustafson?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yah, it's over the wire, it's everywhere, they'll find 'em.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Copy.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We've got a -

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: There's the car! There's the car!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Whose car?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: My car! My car! Tan Ciera!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Don't go in! Wait for back-up!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: ...Chief Gunderson?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Copy. Yah, send me back-up!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Yes, ma'am. Are we the closest PD?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, Menominie only has Chief Perpich and he takes February off to go to Boundary Waters.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Thanks, hon. Time to shove off.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Love ya, Margie.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Hon?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Prowler needs a jump.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Thanks, hon.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You bet. Thanks for lunch. What do we got here, Arbie's?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: ...How's the paintin' goin'?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Pretty good. Found out the Hautmans are entering a painting this year.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Aw, hon, you're better'n them.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: They're real good.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: They're good, Norm, but you're better'n them.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah, ya think?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah, okay. How's the hotel?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, pretty good. They bitin'?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yeah, couple a muskies. No pike yet. How d'you feel?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, fine.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Not on your feet too much?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: You shouldn't be on your feet too much, you got weight you're not used too. How's the food down there?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Had dinner at a place called the King's Table. Buffet style. It was pretty darn good.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Was it reasonable?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah, not too bad. So it's nice up there?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah, it's good. No pike yet, but it's good.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: They announced it?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Three-cent stamp.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Your mallard?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Norm, that's terrific!

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: It's just the three cent.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It's terrific!

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Hautman's blue-winged teal got the twenty-nine cent. People don't much use the three-cent.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, for Pete's - a course they do! Every time they raise the darned postage, people need the little stamps!

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: When they're stuck with a bunch a the old ones!

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yah, I guess.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: That's terrific.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: I love you, Margie.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I love you, Norm.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: We called his house; his little boy said he hadn't been there.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: And his wife?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: She's visiting relatives in Florida. Now his boss, this guy Gustafson, he's also disappeared. Nobody at his office knows where he is.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Geez. Looks like this thing goes higher than we thought. You call his home?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: His wife's in the hospital, has been for a couple months. The big C.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh, my.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: And this Shep Proudfoot character, he's a little darling. He's now wanted for assault and parole violation. He clobbered a neighbor of his last night and another person who could be one of your perps, and he's at large.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Boy, this thing is really... geez.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Well, they're all out on the wire. Well, you know...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Yah. Well, I just can't thank you enough, Detective Sibert, this cooperation has been outstanding.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: This is do-able.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Congratulations, Jerry.
